query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Lì si cantò non Bacco, non Peana, 26 ma tre persone in divina natura, 27 e in una persona essa e l’umana.
query.result:
**English:**
25 There they sang not Bacchus, not Paean, 26 but three Persons in divine nature, 27 and in one Person it and the human.
**Malay:**
25 Di sana mereka tidak menyanyikan Bacchus, tidak Peana, 26 tetapi tiga Pribadi dalam kodrat ilahi, 27 dan dalam satu Pribadi itu dan manusia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Compié ’l cantare e ’l volger sua misura; 29 e attesersi a noi quei santi lumi, 30 felicitando sé di cura in cura.
query.result:
**English:**
28 The singing and the circling of their measure ceased; 29 and those holy lights waited for us, 30 blessing themselves from care to care.
**Malay:**
28 Berakhirlah nyanyian dan putaran ukuran mereka; 29 dan cahaya-cahaya suci itu menunggu kami, 30 memberkati diri mereka sendiri dari satu perhatian ke perhatian lainnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
31 Ruppe il silenzio ne’ concordi numi 32 poscia la luce in che mirabil vita 33 del poverel di Dio narrata fumi,
34 e disse: «Quando l’una paglia è trita, 35 quando la sua semenza è già riposta, 36 a batter l’altra dolce amor m’invita.
query.result:
**English:**
31 Then the harmonious gods broke the silence, 32 after the light in which the wondrous life 33 of God’s poor man was narrated to you,
34 and said: “When one straw is threshed, 35 when its seed is already stored, 36 sweet love invites me to thresh the other.
**Malay:**
31 Kemudian para dewa yang harmonis memecah kesunyian, 32 setelah cahaya di mana kehidupan menakjubkan 33 dari orang miskin Tuhan diriwayatkan kepadamu,
34 dan berkata: “Ketika satu jerami telah dirontokkan, 35 ketika bijinya telah disimpan, 36 cinta yang manis mengundangku untuk merontokkan yang lain.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Tu credi che nel petto onde la costa 38 si trasse per formar la bella guancia 39 il cui palato a tutto ’l mondo costa,
40 e in quel che, forato da la lancia, 41 e prima e poscia tanto sodisfece, 42 che d’ogne colpa vince la bilancia,
43 quantunque a la natura umana lece 44 aver di lume, tutto fosse infuso 45 da quel valor che l’uno e l’altro fece;
46 e però miri a ciò ch’io dissi suso, 47 quando narrai che non ebbe ’l secondo 48 lo ben che ne la quinta luce è chiuso.
query.result:
**English:**
37 You believe that in the breast where the rib 38 was drawn out to form the lovely cheek 39 whose palate cost the whole world so dear,
40 and in that which, pierced by the lance, 41 both before and after gave such satisfaction 42 that it outweighs every sin in the balance,
43 as much light as is permitted to human nature 44 was infused by that power which made both the one and the other;
45 and therefore look at what I said above, 46 when I related that the second had not 47 the good that is enclosed in the fifth light.
**Malay:**
37 Engkau percaya bahwa di dalam dada tempat tulang rusuk 38 ditarik keluar untuk membentuk pipi yang cantik 39 yang langit-langitnya sangat mahal bagi seluruh dunia,
40 dan di dalam yang, ditusuk oleh tombak, 41 baik sebelum dan sesudahnya memberikan kepuasan yang besar 42 sehingga melebihi setiap dosa di timbangan,
43 sebanyak cahaya yang diizinkan untuk sifat manusia 44 diresapi oleh kekuatan yang membuat keduanya;
45 dan oleh karena itu lihatlah apa yang kukatakan di atas, 46 ketika aku menceritakan bahwa yang kedua tidak memiliki 47 kebaikan yang terkandung dalam cahaya kelima.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 Or apri li occhi a quel ch’io ti rispondo, 50 e vedräi il tuo credere e ’l mio dire 51 nel vero farsi come centro in tondo.
query.result:
**English:**
49 Now open your eyes to what I answer you, 50 and you will see your belief and my words 51 become true, like a center in a circle.
**Malay:**
49 Sekarang bukalah matamu terhadap apa yang kujawab, 50 dan engkau akan melihat kepercayaanmu dan ucapanku 51 menjadi kenyataan, seperti pusat dalam lingkaran.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 Ciò che non more e ciò che può morire 53 non è se non splendor di quella idea 54 che partorisce, amando, il nostro Sire;
55 ché quella viva luce che sì mea 56 dal suo lucente, che non si disuna 57 da lui né da l’amor ch’a lor s’intrea,
58 per sua bontate il suo raggiare aduna, 59 quasi specchiato, in nove sussistenze, 60 etternalmente rimanendosi una.
query.result:
**English:**
52 That which does not die and that which can die 53 is nothing but the splendor of that idea 54 that our Lord begets, loving;
55 for that living light which so streams 56 from its brightness, which is never separated 57 from it nor from the love that interpenetrates them,
58 by its goodness gathers its radiance 59 as if mirrored, into nine subsistences, 60 remaining eternally one.
**Malay:**
52 Apa yang tidak mati dan apa yang dapat mati 53 tidak lain hanyalah pancaran dari idea itu 54 yang dilahirkan, dengan penuh kasih, oleh Tuhan kita;
55 karena cahaya hidup itu yang begitu mengalir 56 dari kecemerlangannya, yang tidak pernah terpisah 57 darinya atau dari kasih yang saling menembus mereka,
58 oleh kebaikannya mengumpulkan pancarannya 59 seolah-olah tercermin, ke dalam sembilan keberadaan, 60 tetap menjadi satu selamanya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 La cera di costoro e chi la duce 68 non sta d’un modo; e però sotto ’l segno 69 idëale poi più e men traluce.
query.result:
**English:**
67 The wax of these people and he who leads them 68 do not stand in one way; and therefore under the sign 69 ideal then more and less shines through.
**Malay:**
67 Lilin dari orang-orang ini dan dia yang memimpin mereka 68 tidak berdiri dengan satu cara; dan oleh karena itu di bawah tanda 69 ideal kemudian lebih dan kurang bersinar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 Ond’ elli avvien ch’un medesimo legno, 71 secondo specie, meglio e peggio frutta; 72 e voi nascete con diverso ingegno.
query.result:
**English:**
70 Hence it happens that one and the same tree, 71 according to its species, bears better and worse fruit; 72 and you are born with different talents.
**Malay:**
70 Oleh karena itu terjadilah bahwa satu pohon yang sama, 71 menurut spesiesnya, menghasilkan buah yang lebih baik dan lebih buruk; 72 dan kamu dilahirkan dengan bakat yang berbeda.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
79 Però se ’l caldo amor la chiara vista 80 de la prima virtù dispone e segna, 81 tutta la perfezion quivi s’acquista.
query.result:
**English:**
79 But if the warm love disposes and marks 80 the clear vision of the first virtue, 81 all perfection is acquired here.
**Malay:**
79 Tetapi jika cinta yang hangat itu mengatur dan menandai 80 penglihatan yang jelas dari kebajikan pertama, 81 semua kesempurnaan diperoleh di sini.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 Or s’i’ non procedesse avanti piùe, 89 ‘Dunque, come costui fu sanza pare?’ 90 comincerebber le parole tue.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Now if I did not proceed further, 89 ‘Then how was he without equal?’ 90 your words would begin.
**Malay:**
88 Sekarang jika aku tidak melanjutkan lebih jauh, 89 ‘Jadi, bagaimana dia tidak ada bandingannya?’ 90 kata-katamu akan dimulai.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 Ma perché paia ben ciò che non pare, 92 pensa chi era, e la cagion che ’l mosse, 93 quando fu detto “Chiedi”, a dimandare.
query.result:
**English:**
91 But so that what does not appear may appear well, 92 consider who he was, and the reason that moved him, 93 when it was said, “Ask,” to ask.
**Malay:**
91 Tetapi agar apa yang tidak tampak dapat tampak dengan baik, 92 pikirkan siapa dia, dan alasan yang menggerakkannya, 93 ketika dikatakan, “Mintalah,” untuk meminta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Con questa distinzion prendi ’l mio detto; 110 e così puote star con quel che credi 111 del primo padre e del nostro Diletto.
query.result:
**English:**
109 With this distinction, take my statement; 110 and thus it can stand with what you believe 111 about the first father and our Beloved.
**Malay:**
109 Dengan pembedaan ini, ambillah perkataanku; 110 dan dengan demikian ia dapat berdiri dengan apa yang kau yakini 111 tentang bapak pertama dan Kekasih kita.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 E questo ti sia sempre piombo a’ piedi, 113 per farti mover lento com’ uom lasso 114 e al sì e al no che tu non vedi:
115 ché quelli è tra li stolti bene a basso, 116 che sanza distinzione afferma e nega 117 ne l’un così come ne l’altro passo;
118 perch’ elli ’ncontra che più volte piega 119 l’oppinïon corrente in falsa parte, 120 e poi l’affetto l’intelletto lega.
query.result:
**English:**
112 And let this always be a weight upon your feet, 113 to make you move slowly like a weary man 114 and to the yes and the no that you do not see:
115 for he is among the fools, down in the lowest place, 116 who affirms and denies without distinction 117 in the one case as in the other;
118 because he often finds that the common opinion 119 turns out to be false, 120 and then his intellect is bound by his emotions.
**Malay:**
112 Dan biarlah ini selalu menjadi beban di kakimu, 113 untuk membuatmu bergerak lambat seperti orang yang lelah 114 dan pada ya dan tidak yang tidak kamu lihat:
115 karena dia termasuk orang-orang bodoh, di tempat yang paling rendah, 116 yang menegaskan dan menyangkal tanpa perbedaan 117 dalam satu kasus seperti dalam kasus lainnya;
118 karena dia sering menemukan bahwa opini umum 119 ternyata salah, 120 dan kemudian inteleknya terikat oleh emosinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 Vie più che ’ndarno da riva si parte, 122 perché non torna tal qual e’ si move, 123 chi pesca per lo vero e non ha l’arte.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Woe to him who sets out from the shore in vain, 122 because he does not return as he sets out, 123 who fishes for the truth and does not have the skill.
**Malay:**
121 Celakalah dia yang berangkat dari pantai dengan sia-sia, 122 karena dia tidak kembali seperti saat dia berangkat, 123 siapa yang memancing kebenaran dan tidak memiliki keterampilan.
